## Example: Economic Downturn

:::: columns

::: {.column width="50%" #vcenter .r-fit-text}
 - Economic Downturn not specified in Basel Framework or CRR
 - EBA has drafted an RTS, elevated into regulation CDR 2021/930
 - EGIM is not more specific
:::


::: {.column width="50%" #vcenter .r-fit-text}
::: {.callout-note}
## CRE 36.85
$\small{[\cdots]}$ _A bank must estimate an LGD for each facility that aims to reflect economic downturn conditions where necessary to capture the relevant risks._ $\small{[\cdots]}$
:::
::: {.callout-note}
## CRR Article 181
_(1)(b) institutions shall use LGD estimates that are appropriate for an economic downturn if those are more conservative than the long-run average._ $\small{[\cdots]}$

_(3) EBA shall develop draft regulatory technical standards to specify the following: (a) the nature, severity and duration of an economic downturn referred to in paragraph 1;_ $\small{[\cdots]}$
:::

::: {.callout-note}
## CDR 2021/930 Article 1
_Specification of the nature, severity and duration of an economic downturn_ $\small{[\cdots]}$
:::
:::
::::

::: notes
Show Basel CRE36.64, article 4(78), GL PD/LGD par 73ff
:::
